abstract.p: Correction of Sept 29 article about new paint technologies

block.p: An article in the Automobiles section on Sept. 29 about new paint technologies misstated the number of special Ford Mustang Cobras painted with Flex Products' ChromaFlair, a color-shifting paint, and their hues. It was 2,000, not 1,200 cars, and the color changed from dark green to dark purple, not from deep blue to purple-black. The article also misstated the period in which Nissan used ChromaFlair on two cars in Europe. It was 1998 and 1999, not this year.

The article also misstated Flex Products' investment in new pigment plants, and the number of new plants in Asia. It is more than $45 million, not $15 million, and the company is building one Asian plant, not two.
The article referred incorrectly to the pigment used on numerals of the $20 bill. It is an ink used only in the printing of securities; it is not ChromaFlair.
